detail.content: Production Center: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Undergraduate Film & Television Admissions About the Program Course Offerings Summer Courses Showcase Internships Facilities Special Projects First Run & Festivals Calendar of Events News TSOA FTV Wiki Admin & Faculty Alumni Blog Facebook Twitter YouTube  home > Undergraduate Film & TV        Production Center  NYU boasts one of the largest filmmaking facilities on the Eastern Seaboard, serving the needs of both our Undergraduate and Graduate film and video students. The facility is run by 11 full-time staff members and over 50 technical assistants that are both technically and professionally trained in many technical and aesthetic aspects of film production, including: film planning and production, equipment operation, equipment maintenance and repair.    The Production Center supports every aspect of the well-over 4,500 student projects shot every year, with technical seminars, industry-professional equipment, film stock and supplies, equipment repair services, and additional support for planning and development of student films. The equipment packages vary by level of study (fundamental through advanced/thesis), and are available to students enrolled in production courses. the production center consists of 5 areas which include the Advanced and Fundamental Equipment Areas, Repair Shop, Equipment Reservations Office, and the Production Office, which provides the students with the supplies and resources needed to produce a film or video.  Production Coordinator Eric Juhola 721 Broadway 9th floor New York, NY 10003 Phone: (212) 998-1790           Undergraduate Admissions Graduate Admissions Academic Services Student Life Financial Aid and Scholarships Career Development Counseling Services International Students Incoming Students Graduation Forms What is Special Programs? Post Production: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Undergraduate Film & Television Admissions About the Program Course Offerings Summer Courses Showcase Internships Facilities Special Projects First Run & Festivals Calendar of Events News TSOA FTV Wiki Admin & Faculty Alumni Blog Facebook Twitter YouTube  home > Undergraduate Film & TV        Post Production                                          The Post Production Center (PPC) at NYU’s Kanbar  Institute of Film & Television provides all the state-of-the-art hardware,  software applications, and operational/technical support that are necessary to support  the editing needs of an artistic filmmaking community that produces almost 8000  student projects per year.                                         Approximately 150 workstations located on the 10 th   & 11 th floors of Tisch School of the Arts are loaded with Final  Cut Pro, Avid Media Composer, or Pro Tools (or combinations of all three  applications) and are available in various configurations: multi-station  computer labs; single station edit suites; ADR, Foley, Mix & Recording  studios; dubbing/duplication facilities; film & video screening rooms;  Sound FX stations, etc.). Staff  and student workers at the PPC Checkout Window on either floor are there to  give assistance and information based on the Film & Television curriculum.                                           Currently supported formats in the PPC include  HDCAM (NOT HDCAM SR), RED, DVCPRO HD, DVCAM, Panasonic  P2, Sony EX-1, and multiple file formats related to emerging technology such as  AVCHD based camcorders and Canon 7D/5D DSLRs . Students are encouraged to meet with full time PPC staff members  who are available to answer questions about these formats and workflows and to  assist students in finishing their projects. The PPC is open during the  semester seven (7) days per week, 12-14 hours per day. Students should be sure to read the PPC  signage on a weekly basis for updates on important dates such as closings,  weekly workshops, technical seminars, and other events that will add to the  creative experience here at TSOA. Intermediate Animation Prod: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Undergraduate Film & Television Admissions About the Program Course Offerings Summer Courses Showcase Internships Facilities Special Projects First Run & Festivals Calendar of Events News TSOA FTV Wiki Admin & Faculty Alumni Blog Facebook Twitter YouTube  home > Undergraduate Film & TV        Intermediate Animation Production  FMTV-UT.1329 Stu 4 Credits  Course Level: Intermediate 4 points Prerequisite: Animation Action Analysis I(H56.1328) or permission of instructor. Recommended for students studying both animation and live action.                            An intensive intermediate core prodution class exploring "personality" animation: creating characters that think and express emotions. Students analyze live action and animated films frame-by-frame. Also, by semester's end students will produce a short film or video (less than one minute) using 3-D or 2-D techniques that incorporate the principles of personality animation. Students will gain experience in all phases of animation production, including concept art, storyboards, layouts, exposure sheets, test animation, inbtweening, final animation, color, sound, etc.           Undergraduate Admissions Graduate Admissions Academic Services Student Life Financial Aid and Scholarships Career Development Counseling Services International Students Incoming Students Graduation Forms What is Special Programs?
